intro: Alsodeia arborea, commonly known as the tree alsodeia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters. The plant features opposite, simple, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy on the underside. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and are usually pink or white in color. Alsodeia arborea is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant in Mediterranean climates.
